column4: so... on Jaunty how precisely does someone "fix" the tor problem
what tor prob?

well I followed the instructions to install Tor and its broken on firefox, it doesnt forward, and apt-get install tor does not work, only privoxy. And on FF it doesnt forward anything even after modifying the config file on /etc/privoxy
/etc/init.d/tor restart|stop|start doesnt work anymore
maybe not the solution you are looking for, but when i wanted to try out Tor i used an Opera Browser with Tor "baked in". Called "OperaTor"  cehck it out
personally i just use a proxy server, or VPN now.. but it was alright imo. good idea
as a test? so if it works in Opera then it could work in FF
if it works, the you know that is just a setup problem on your end.  If not, then look to your routers ports/firewall
um i just noticed something, Network Proxy isnt installed by default on Jaunty. Do you know why? or how to install it
wait sorry it is installed
fixed tor, I didnt install the packages as stated in the instructions
just a config error then ?
no, not only a config error. I didnt install tor from the place the instructions said, so I had no tor whatsoever installed, just privoxy, everything was being forwarded, but Tor just wasnt there
lol.. yeah usualy helps when you install the program you are trying to use :p  hehe. Well im glad you got it all sorted. Did you check out OperaTor?
i guess i'll check it out
its "opera" right?
the base browser is opera yes.
the full name is OperaTor tho.. its a modded version of opera
aint in the repositories, should i check elsewhere
you should be able to download an .exe and use wine to run it
just google
get supported by the US govt? :p
